code: @Manual{,   title = {lobsteR: Access and Process 'LOBSTER' High-Frequency Data},   author = {Karol Kulma and Stefan Voigt},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/voigtstefan/lobsteR}, }

what: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: lobsteR provides tidy workflow requesting, downloading, reading LOBSTER high-frequency order book data directly R. LOBSTER reconstructs full limit order books NASDAQ historical message data delivers pairs message files order book snapshot files. package handles end--end pipeline — authentication, request submission, archive retrieval, file download — can focus analysis. downstream high-frequency econometrics, see highfrequency package. Prerequisites: active account lobsterdata.com required request download data.

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: Install released version CRAN: development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("lobsteR") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("voigtstefan/lobsteR")

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
code: library(lobsteR)

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: Store credentials .Renviron (open usethis::edit_r_environ()) avoid hardcoding scripts: authenticate:
code: LOBSTER_USER=you@example.com LOBSTER_PWD=your-password lobster_login <- account_login(   login = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_USER"),   pwd   = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_PWD") )

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: request_query() expands symbol date range one row per trading day, automatically removing weekends NYSE holidays. level sets number order book price levels included snapshot files (e.g. 10 returns top 10 bid ask levels). large date ranges, use frequency = "1 month" submit one request per month rather one per day, reduces load LOBSTER server.

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: LOBSTER processes requests server-side. Depending volume messages, can take anywhere minutes several hours. can safely close R session waiting — processing continues LOBSTER servers.
code: request_submit(   account_login = lobster_login,   request       = data_request )

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: processing complete, files appear account archive: returned tibble one row per available dataset columns id, symbol, start_date, end_date, level, size, download.
code: lobster_archive <- account_archive(account = lobster_login) lobster_archive

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: Downloaded .7z archives extracted automatically. Pass unzip = FALSE keep raw archives. Note extraction runs background process, function returns files fully written disk — check path directory proceeding analysis.
code: dir.create("data-lobster", showWarnings = FALSE)  data_download(   requested_data = dplyr::filter(lobster_archive, symbol == "MSFT"),   account_login  = lobster_login,   path           = "data-lobster" )

title: Access and Process LOBSTER High-Frequency Data
text: archive package used .7z extraction requires system libraries. Debian/Ubuntu system:
code: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y gpgv gnupg libarchive13t64 liblz4-dev libacl1-dev libext2fs-dev nettle-dev sudo apt-get install -y libarchive-dev

what: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: Fetches information available datasets LOBSTER account archive. includes details symbols, date ranges, order book levels, file sizes, download links available dataset.

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
code: account_archive(account)

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: account list Output account_login() containing valid authenticated session (valid == TRUE).

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: tibble one row per available dataset columns: id integer. Unique identifier dataset. symbol character. Stock/ETF ticker symbol (e.g., "SPY", "AAPL"). start_date Date. First date data coverage. end_date Date. Last date data coverage. level integer. Order book depth (number price levels). size integer. File size bytes. download character. Direct download URL dataset. Rows ordered id descending (recently requested first). Datasets zero file size (yet processed LOBSTER) excluded.

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
text: function navigates archive page authenticated session, scrapes archive table, extracts download links, returns structured tibble. datasets non-zero file sizes included — datasets still processed LOBSTER appear processing complete.

title: Retrieve LOBSTER data archive information — account_archive
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ acct <- account_login(   login = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_USER"),   pwd   = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_PWD") )  archive <- account_archive(acct) archive #> # A tibble: 3 × 7 #>      id symbol start_date end_date   level    size download #>   <int> <chr>  <date>     <date>     <int>   <int> <chr> #> 1   102 AAPL   2023-01-03 2023-01-03     1  204800 https://… #> 2   101 MSFT   2023-01-03 2023-01-05     2  512000 https://… #> 3   100 SPY    2022-12-01 2022-12-31    10 1048576 https://…  # Filter to a single symbol before downloading data_download(   requested_data = archive[archive$symbol == "AAPL", ],   account_login  = acct,   path           = "data-lobster" ) } # }

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: Logs LOBSTER account creates session object subsequent data requests. function handles authentication process lobsterdata.com validates login successful.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
code: account_login(login, pwd)

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: login character(1) Email address associated LOBSTER account. pwd character(1) Account password.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: named list components: valid logical(1) — TRUE authentication succeeded. session rvest session object used navigation. submission rvest response returned sign-form submitted.

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
text: function submits sign-form using AJAX header (x-requested-: XMLHttpRequest) confirms success checking redirect URL. Network connectivity valid credentials required. Store credentials .Renviron file (usethis::edit_r_environ()) avoid hardcoding scripts:
code: LOBSTER_USER=you@example.com LOBSTER_PWD=your-password

title: Authenticate with LOBSTER account — account_login
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ acct <- account_login(   login = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_USER"),   pwd   = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_PWD") )  if (acct$valid) {   # Retrieve available datasets in the archive   archive <- account_archive(acct)    # Build and submit a new data request   req <- request_query("AAPL", "2023-01-03", "2023-01-05", level = 1)   request_submit(acct, req) } } # }

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: Download one files listed requested_data using authenticated session account_login. Files written path. file write optional extraction performed background R process (via callr::r_bg()). unzip = TRUE original .7z archive removed extraction.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
code: data_download(requested_data, account_login, path = ".", unzip = TRUE)

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: requested_data data.frame tibble archive metadata must include minimum download column (full download URL) id column. Typically (filtered) result account_archive(). account_login list Output account_login() containing authenticated session used fetch file content. path character(1) Directory downloaded files written (unzip = TRUE) extracted. directory must already exist; create first dir.create(path, recursive = TRUE) needed. unzip logical(1) TRUE (default) extract downloaded .7z archive using archive::archive_extract() delete archive file afterwards. Set FALSE keep raw archive.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Files written path background R processes launched via callr::r_bg(). processes monitored launch; verify expected files exist path proceeding analysis.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
text: row requested_data function fetches file content via authenticated session spawns background process write optionally extract file. extraction runs background, function returns files fully written disk.

title: Download requested archive files — data_download
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ acct    <- account_login(Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_USER"), Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_PWD")) archive <- account_archive(acct)  # Download all AAPL files to a local directory dir.create("data-lobster", showWarnings = FALSE) data_download(   requested_data = archive[archive$symbol == "AAPL", ],   account_login  = acct,   path           = "data-lobster" )  # Keep the raw .7z archives without extracting data_download(   requested_data = archive,   account_login  = acct,   path           = "data-lobster",   unzip          = FALSE ) } # }

what: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: Construct request describing trading-day files ask LOBSTER . symbol date range function expands range one row per calendar day, converts level integer, (optionally) validates requested days removing weekends, NYSE holidays days already present provided account archive.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
code: request_query(   symbol,   start_date,   end_date,   level,   validate = TRUE,   account_archive = NULL,   frequency = "1 day" )

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: symbol character vector One ticker symbols (e.g. "AAPL"). element paired corresponding elements start_date, end_date level. Recycling follows base R rules; mismatched lengths avoided. start_date Date-like (Date character) Start date(s) requested range(s). Converted .Date(). end_date Date-like (Date character) End date(s) requested range(s). Converted .Date(). level integer(1) Required order-book snapshot level (e.g. 1, 2, 10). validate logical(1) TRUE (default) remove weekend days NYSE holidays. account_archive also supplied, days already present archive additionally removed avoid duplicate requests. account_archive data.frame tibble, optional Archive table returned account_archive(). provided, rows already present archive (matched symbol, start_date, end_date, level) excluded. frequency character(1) Frequency string passed seq.Date(). Defaults "1 day" (one row per trading day). Use "1 month" large date ranges reduce number individual requests sent LOBSTER server. Validation (validate = TRUE) applied frequency == "1 day".

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: data.frame one row per period columns: symbol: character start_date: Date — start period (equal end_date daily requests) end_date: Date — end period level: integer validate = TRUE frequency = "1 day", weekend days NYSE holidays silently removed, output typically contains fewer rows full calendar span requested date range.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
text: function performs network activity. Use request_submit() send generated request authenticated LOBSTER session.

title: Create a LOBSTER data request (one row per trading day) — request_query
code: # Single symbol, one-week range (weekends and holidays removed automatically) request_query("AAPL", "2023-01-02", "2023-01-06", level = 1) #>   symbol start_date   end_date level #> 2   AAPL 2023-01-03 2023-01-03     1 #> 3   AAPL 2023-01-04 2023-01-04     1 #> 4   AAPL 2023-01-05 2023-01-05     1 #> 5   AAPL 2023-01-06 2023-01-06     1  # Multiple symbols with paired date ranges request_query(   symbol     = c("AAPL", "MSFT"),   start_date = c("2023-01-03", "2023-02-01"),   end_date   = c("2023-01-05", "2023-02-03"),   level      = 1 ) #>   symbol start_date   end_date level #> 1   AAPL 2023-01-03 2023-01-03     1 #> 2   AAPL 2023-01-04 2023-01-04     1 #> 3   AAPL 2023-01-05 2023-01-05     1 #> 4   MSFT 2023-02-01 2023-02-01     1 #> 5   MSFT 2023-02-02 2023-02-02     1 #> 6   MSFT 2023-02-03 2023-02-03     1  # Monthly frequency for a large date range (no per-day expansion) request_query(   symbol     = "SPY",   start_date = "2022-01-01",   end_date   = "2022-12-31",   level      = 10,   frequency  = "1 month" ) #>    symbol start_date   end_date level #> 1     SPY 2022-01-01 2022-01-31    10 #> 2     SPY 2022-02-01 2022-02-28    10 #> 3     SPY 2022-03-01 2022-03-31    10 #> 4     SPY 2022-04-01 2022-04-30    10 #> 5     SPY 2022-05-01 2022-05-31    10 #> 6     SPY 2022-06-01 2022-06-30    10 #> 7     SPY 2022-07-01 2022-07-31    10 #> 8     SPY 2022-08-01 2022-08-31    10 #> 9     SPY 2022-09-01 2022-09-30    10 #> 10    SPY 2022-10-01 2022-10-31    10 #> 11    SPY 2022-11-01 2022-11-30    10 #> 12    SPY 2022-12-01 2022-12-31    10  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Exclude days already in the archive to avoid duplicate requests acct    <- account_login(Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_USER"), Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_PWD")) archive <- account_archive(acct)  req <- request_query(   symbol          = "AAPL",   start_date      = "2023-01-02",   end_date        = "2023-01-31",   level           = 1,   account_archive = archive ) } # }

what: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
text: Send prepared request rows lobsterdata.com using authenticated session contained account_login. row request submitted separate HTTP request. function performs network side effects returns invisibly.

title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
code: request_submit(account_login, request)

title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
text: account_login list Output account_login() contains successful authenticated session (valid == TRUE) submission response required navigation. request data.frame tibble returned request_query() columns: symbol, start_date, end_date, level.

title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
text: Invisibly returns NULL. primary effect queue requests LOBSTER server; processing happens server-side may take time. Use account_archive() afterwards check files become available.

title: Submit one or more requests to an authenticated LOBSTER account — request_submit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ acct <- account_login(   login = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_USER"),   pwd   = Sys.getenv("LOBSTER_PWD") )  # Build a request and submit it req <- request_query("AAPL", "2023-01-03", "2023-01-05", level = 1) request_submit(acct, req)  # LOBSTER processes the request server-side; this may take several minutes. # Once done, the files appear in the account archive. archive <- account_archive(acct) } # }

title: lobsteR 1.0.0
text: Initial CRAN submission.
